titles.title: Providing for the consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 107-356, by Mr. Hastings (WA).
The resolution provides for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 121.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 342.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 212 - 204 (Roll no. 8).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 2/5/2002--Reported to House without amendment. Makes it in order at any time on February 6, 2002, for the Speaker of the House of Representatives to entertain motions that the House suspend the rules on the following measures: (1) H.Con. Res. 312 (advocating the scheduled tax relief provided for by the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001); (2) H.J. Res. 82 (recognizing the 91st birthday of Ronald Reagan); and (3) H. Res. 340 (recognizing and honoring Jack Shea, Olympic gold medalist).
